content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><pubdate>1997</pubdate><title>Digital Raster Graphic (DRG) Series of Idaho (1 x 2 Degree Quadrangle; 1:250,000-scale)</title><pubinfo><pubplace>Reston, VA, USA</pubplace><publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish></pubinfo><origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin><geoform>raster digital data</geoform><serinfo><issue>series</issue></serinfo></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This data series contains 24 1:250,000-scale Digital Raster Graphic tiles.  The data cover all of Idaho.  The Digital Raster Graphic (DRG) is a raster image of a scanned USGS topographic map including the collar information, georeferenced to the UTM grid.  The bounding coordinates are not specific to individual DRGs but rather to the entire state.</abstract><purpose>A DRG is useful as a source or background layer in a GIS, as a means to perform quality assurance on other digital products, and as a source for the collection and revision of DLG data.  DRG's can also be merged with other digital data, e.g. DEM's or DOQ's, to produce a hybrid digital file.</purpose><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><rngdates><begdate>19960911</begdate><enddate>19971009</enddate></rngdates></timeinfo><current>ground condition</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>Irregular</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-119.3</westbc><eastbc>-108.9</eastbc><northbc>49.3</northbc><southbc>40.6</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">410753.880054</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">590789.080054</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">4516240.393905</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">4656676.993905</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt><themekey>imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</themekey></theme><place><placekt>Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the Identification of the States, The District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas Of The United States, and Associated Areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology.</placekt><placekey>ID</placekey></place><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>Digital Raster Graphic</themekey><themekey>DRG</themekey><themekey>Topographic Map</themekey></theme></keywords><accconst>none</accconst><useconst>Acknowledgment of the USGS would be appreciated in products derived from these data.</useconst><native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4;
